snippet: At the close of an often-divisive presidency, Cristina Fernández de Kirchner boycotted the ceremony after a bitter argument over how and where to hold it.
abstract: Argentina's outgoing president Cristina Fernandez de Kirchner boycotts swearing-in and formal transfer of power to Mauricio Macri, who defeated her in rancorous election; divisive move is latest in tenure critics say thrived on polarization; supporters show solidarity and skepticism towards Macri's stated wish to move country towards unity.
lead_paragraph: At the close of an often-divisive presidency, Cristina Fernández de Kirchner boycotted the ceremony after a bitter argument over how and where to hold it.

headline.main: Mauricio Macri, Argentina’s New President, Is Sworn In Amid Feud With Predecessor
headline.print_headline: In Argentina, a Ceremony and a Snub
